questions.question_text:
A marketer is updating a data extension by manually importing a file. The marketer wants to ensure only new records are added to the data extension during the import process.
In which two ways should the data extension and import be configured? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: BD. Add only will create duplicate if the record already exists

comments.content: Not if you set the primary key it won't. "Add only - The import creates records for primary keys that do not exist in the data extension and ignores records whose primary keys exist." (https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.mc_es_import_into_de.htm&type=5)

By "record" it means a whole row. The marketer only wants to add new rows (rows that don't currently exist), a row uniqueness is defined by the primary key, meaning this process is simply going to verify if a particular primary key is already part of the data, if yes, skip (it is not a new record), if not, add it. The ask is not to update existing records, but to add new records. So AC.

Yes, but since the question is framed such that we assume the two ways need to be exclusive, BD makes more sense because even if there is no Primary Key set, Add and Update will take care of the duplicate records

choices.D: Select the update type ג€Add and Updateג€.
choices.B: Ensure the data extension has a Primary Key.
choices.C: Select the update type ג€Add Onlyג€.

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters wants to maintain enterprise-wide opt-outs for two segments of its subscribers stored in data extensions: Education Events and Sales.
What feature should the company use to manage its opt-out strategy?

Northern Trail Outfitters wants to use a File Drop Starting Source in Automation Studio to send shipping tracking emails when orders are dispatched. A delimited text file containing all the data for the send will be uploaded to a designated directory on the Enhanced SFTP Account, and the email should be sent to customers when the file transfer has completed.
What would be the correct sequence of Activities for this File Drop Starting Source?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
To send shipping tracking emails when orders are dispatched using a File Drop Starting Source in Automation Studio, the correct sequence of activities would be:
D. File Transfer Activity > Import File Activity > Send Email
Here's why:
1. File Transfer Activity: This activity ensures that the file is moved from the Enhanced SFTP to the appropriate location within Marketing Cloud.
2. Import File Activity: This activity imports the data from the file into a data extension.
3. Send Email: This activity sends the email to the customers using the data imported into the data extension.
This sequence ensures that the file is properly transferred and the data is imported before the email is sent.

comments.content:
Let's clarify why option A is not the best choice:
A. Import File Activity > Send Email
This sequence assumes that the file is already in the correct location within Marketing Cloud for the Import File Activity to process it. However, in the scenario described, the file is initially uploaded to a designated directory on the Enhanced SFTP account. Therefore, you need to first transfer the file from the SFTP to the appropriate location within Marketing Cloud before you can import it.

discussion.content:
D is the answer. 
For example, Automation Studio can execute an automation whenever a file matching a naming convention is dropped into a specified location. The file is transferred to another location and imported into a data extension. After 12 hours, an email is triggered. Here’s how that automation is configured. 
 https://trailhead.salesforce.com/content/learn/modules/automation-studio-activities/automate-marketing-cloud-tasks?trailmix_creator_id=strailhead&trailmix_slug=prepare-for-your-marketing-cloud-email-specialist-credential
why not B? I think File Transfer Activity can also be included...

Selected Answer: A
Import File Activity: After the file is detected by the File Drop Starting Source, the next step is to import the data from the delimited text file into a data extension in Salesforce Marketing Cloud. This activity will map the columns in the file to the fields in the data extension.

Email Send Activity: Once the data is imported into the data extension, the next step is to send the shipping tracking emails to the customers. The Email Send Activity will use the data in the data extension (from the imported file) to personalize and send the emails to the respective customers.
File Transfer is not needed as file transfer activity unzips or decrypts a file found in the Marketing Cloud's Enhanced FTP directory or can securely transfer files from the Marketing Cloud's secure file transfer location, the Safehouse, to a selected FTP location. and there is no need for that here.

choices.B: Import File Activity > File Transfer Activity > Send Email
choices.D: File Transfer Activity > Import File Activity > Send Email

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters manually sent an HTML email to subscribers which contains a link to the wrong landing page for a particular campaign.
Which option minimizes the impact of this error?

discussion.content: c is the answer . Job links can be updated even after email sent

choices.D: Have Support recall the email if it has not yet been opened by a subscriber.
choices.C: Locate the job under Tracking and update the URL in the Job Links tab.
choices.A: Send another email to the same subscribers containing the correct link.
choices.B: Update the link in the stored email content and it will be pulled in automatically.

choices.D: Split the audience equally and configure a holdback population for a control.
choices.A: Split the audience equally and wait at least seven days to select a winner.
choices.B: Split the audience equally and automatically choose the winning path based on Open Rate.
choices.C: Split the audience equally and manually choose the winning path based on Email Engagement Stats.

questions.question_text:
A marketer at Northern Trail Outfitters feels a subject line suggested by their creative team will not be as effective as the one initially recommended by the product team.
Which two ways should Path Optimizer be configured to select the better subject line? (Choose two.)
